intro: Brassica oleracea var. theiusa, commonly known as the Tuscan kale, is a leafy green vegetable characterized by its curly, dark green leaves. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous vegetables like broccoli and cauliflower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a robust stem and thick, succulent leaves. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value and use in culinary applications. The leaves are rich in vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber.
